IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place in Generals Lane.

Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 18th of December 2025 in the CM3 postcode area. Our engineers have advised us that the 10 affected properties will be restored early between approximately 13:15-13:30 as the works have progressed better than expected. We can confirm that once power has been restored to the area that the works for a third party to trim trees around 1 section of overhead cables near The Ridge will be completed which will adhere to the customer request and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work is INCD-105820-C. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 13:08 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the High Street TN33 0 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault on our underground cables, which our engineers have now been able to repair.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 11:37 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that the excavations were delayed due to a car that was parked on the fault location, which has since been moved. Due to the delay this has caused, they've advised a new time of 14:30-15:30 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 13:29 - Hi David here again. I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Swains Lane area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault on the underground electrical equipment, which our engineers have repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:54 - Our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin. Excavations can sometimes take longer than expected, depending on ground conditions, other utility equipment like gas and water pipes, parked vehicles, or local traffic.

At the moment our estimated time frame of 15:30-16:30 hasn't changed, but as our staff are busy working with live electricity we need to wait until they can safely stop work and contact us with the latest information. Once they do, we'll update you further.

Our team are always here if you have any questions.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

Our estimated time frame of 15:30-16:30 doesn't need to change currently. We'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here if you have any questions.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 12:33 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 12:40 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 532 customers in the Great Yarmouth, NR29 area, by diverting power around the overhead network fault. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Adam at 11:25 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that due to the additional excavations and the need for more resources to help with this, unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 21:00 and 22:00 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Will at 16:34.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have advised they need to extend their excavations to be able to make a cut on the faulty cable and restore supplies. They have requested we send an additional digging team to help with this.

Its possible we may have to extend the estimated time frame to allow time for them to arrive and the work to be safely completed. Rest assured, as soon as we have an update on this or any further information, I will let you know. Sent by Will at 16:01.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

It is our intention to return to make a permanent repair as soon as we can.  I'm sorry, but we can't give you a time for this at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 07:02. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 13:27 - We can now confirm that all power in the Victoria Street area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 13:03 - Our staff are on the way to the Victoria Street area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 16:00 and 17:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Luke, Stuart, Decasta, Will, Aaron and Lisa are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 13:28 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV Fuse Replacement/Linking affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this, but we are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 06:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV UG Network Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 16:09 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that their line patrols are taking time due to the weather and also the size of the area they need to check. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 18:30 and 19:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 15:40 - Thanks for your patience this afternoon.

Our staff are currently checking our network equipment throughout the area. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Coulsdon CR5 3 area and are investigating the fault. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 75 customers. There are now 131 properties still affected. We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Will at 15:27.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 14:41. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 16:39 - Our engineers have restored power to all 211 properties in the Godalming, GU8 4 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around an overhead network fault.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Godalming, GU8 4 area to investigate the power cut affecting 123 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Will at 15:28.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 15:04 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead network fault that initially interrupted power to 211 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 123 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 18:00-19:00, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.

We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: An underground electricity cable has faulted on our high voltage network, causing an area wide power cut.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Stuart at 16:38 - Thanks for your patience this afternoon.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our underground cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Eton College Road area to investigate the power cut affecting 271 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Stuart at 16:27.

Sent by Stuart at 16:21 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an underground network fault affecting 271 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 17:30-18:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.

What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV UG Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 18-DEC-2025 18:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Sent by Will at 16:38 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 462 customers in the Wadhurst, TN5 6 and 7 area, by diverting power around the network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
